Nadja.title: Luminous Rot
Nadja.label: Southern Lord
Nadja.about:
For the Japanese Daymare Recordings CD edition visit:
inoxia-rec.com/collections/nadja-3#
Nadja is a duo of multi-instrumentalist Aidan Baker and bassist Leah Buckareff—active since 2005—and making music which can be described as ambient doom, dreamsludge, or metalgaze. Nadja’s signature sound combines the atmospheric textures of shoegaze and ambient/electronic music with the heaviness, density, and volume of metal, noise, and industrial.
For the new album, Luminous Rot, the duo retain their overblown/ambient sound, and explore shorter and more tightly structured songs reflecting their interests not only in metal, but post-punk, cold-wave, shoegaze, and industrial.
Thematically, the album explores ideas of 'first contact' and the difficulties of recognising alien intelligence. This was in part inspired by reading such writers as Stanislaw Lem and Cixin Lui -- in particular, theories on astro-physics, multi-dimensionality, and spatial geometry in "The Three Body Problem" -- as well as Margaret Wertheim's "A Field Guide To Hyperbolic Space," about mathematician Daina Taimina's work with crochet to illustrate hyperbolic space and geometry.
The album was recorded between their home studio, Broken Spine Studios, or Nadja’s live rehearsal studio, both in the district of Lichtenberg, Berlin.
Luminous Rot marks the first album mixed by someone else, who in this case was David Pajo. The band comment, “as big fans of Slint, we thought he might fore-front the more angular, post-punk elements of our music - the mix is quite different from our previous albums. But, as usual, we had James Plotkin (Khanate, OLD, etc) master the album as we trust his ears and aesthetic, as he's mastered numerous records of ours.”
Nadja.credits:
released May 21, 2021
Aidan Baker – guitars, vocals, drum machine
Leah Buckareff – bass guitar, vocals
Recorded at Broken Spine Studios in Berlin, Germany
www.nadjaluv.ca
Mixed by David Pajo
Mastered by James Plotkin
Artwork by Anoop Bhat
© 2021 Southern Lord Recordings

Nadja.title: Melody Snakes
Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about:
Part of the Podsongs podcast series, in which artists interview another artist they consider influential and then write a song about the conversation in collaboration with the Podsongs band. Nadja's Aidan Baker spoke with American novelist Steve Erickson about artistic inspiration, one's sense of place, and shifting political realities, amongst other subjects.
Listen wherever you find your podcasts or use this link:
podsongs.com/podcast-episodes/blog/7404776/from-conversation-to-composition-steve-erickson-and-musician-aidan-baker-on-art-and-experimentation
nadja.bandcamp.com
www.steveerickson.org
Nadja.credits:
released May 24, 2024
Aidan Baker - guitar, drum machines
Leah Buckareff - bass
Jack Stafford - piano, synths
Maurizio Sarnicola - moog dfam, guitar
Ernesto Massimino Voza - synths, drum machine
Luigi Falcione - bass, synths

Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about:
A collaborative album with Italy's OvO, recorded August 2009 at Einstürzende Neubauten's studio in Berlin, Germany. Released by Broken Spine Productions on CD and LP by Adagio830/Vendetta Records in 2010. Mastering by James Plotkin.
www.brokenspineprods.com
ovomusic.bandcamp.com
www.adagio830.de
vendettarecords.wordpress.com
Nadja.credits:
released April 1, 2010
Aidan Baker: guitar
Leah Buckareff: bass
Stefania Predetti: vocals, guitar, vibraphone
Bruno Dorella: drums, bass

Nadja.title: The Perfect World
Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about:
A remastered, remixed, extra-tracked version of Nadja & Vampillia's collaborative album "The Primitive World" released on LP and CD by Important Records.
importantrecords.com/imprec/imprec385
Nadja.credits:
released August 28, 2013
Nadja - guitars, bass, drum machine
Vampillia - guitars, strings, piano, voice

Nadja.title: The Primitive World
Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about: A collaborative release with Vampillia originally released on CD by Iscollage Collective in conjunction with Nadja's Japanese tour in 2012. Re-worked/mixed/mastered for a LP/CD release with Important Records in 2013 as "The Perfect World."
Nadja.credits:
released June 2, 2021
Nadja - guitars, bass, drum machine
Vampillia - piano, strings, vocals, guitars

Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about: Nadja's second collaboration with Fear Falls Burning, initially released on cd by Conspiracy Records.

released May 21, 2007
Aidan Baker - guitars, drums
Leah Buckareff - bass
Dirk Serries - guitars

Nadja.title: Untitled Collaboration
Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about: A spontaneous, live collaboration between Nadja and Datashock recorded live at Oetinger Villa, Darmstadt, DE on May 21, 2007. Released by Meudiademorte as limited edition single-sided LP. Mastered by Pete Swanson (Yellow Swans), artwork by Thomas Weirich, recorded by Matthias Woernle.
Nadja.credits:
released April 1, 2008
Performers – Aidan Baker, Jan Werner, Leah Buckareff, Martina Ripplinger, Pascal Hector, Ronnie Oliveras, Ruth-Maria Adam

Nadja.title: Vestigial Spectra
Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about:
A collaborative album between Nadja and Fawn Limbs, released on vinyl by Wolves & Vibrancy Records (DE), vinyl and CD by Roman Numeral (US), and limited cassette by Sludgelord Records (UK). Australian distro by Crucible Art (EU vinyl editions).
All songs written, performed, and arranged by Fawn Limbs and Nadja
Mixed and mastered by Samuel Vaney at Lead & Sulfur Studio.
wolvesandvibrancyrecords.com
www.romannumeralrecords.com
sludgelordrecords.bandcamp.com
fawnlimbs.bandcamp.com
nadja.bandcamp.com
Nadja.credits:
released November 24, 2023
Fawn Limbs is
Eeli Helin - Guitars, vocals, bass, electronics
Lee Fisher - Drums
Nadja is
Aidan Baker - Guitars, vocals
Leah Buckareff - Bass

Nadja.title: We Have Departed The Circle Blissfully
Nadja.label: Broken Spine Productions
Nadja.about:
Nadja's first collaboration with Fear Falls Burning, tracks 1 & 2 initially released as part of the 10-year anniversary 10-LP collection from Conspiracy Records. Tracks 3 & 4 Aidan Baker remixes of a Fear Falls Burning track initially released on a double 7" by Die Stadt Musik in 2005. Artwork by Seldon Hunt.
www.dirkserries.com
www.diestadtmusik.de
www.seldonhunt.com
Nadja.credits:
released July 1, 2006
Aidan Baker - guitars, drums/machines, vocals
Leah Buckareff - bass
Dirk Serries - guitars
